ygData.subject: RE: Is the verdict finally in?
ygData.msgSnippet: If there were a way to hack the files locally and give yourself items, alter your bank box, or anything important like that, people would have already hacked
ygData.messageBody:
If there were a way to hack the files locally and give yourself items, alter
your bank box, or anything important like that, people would have already
hacked it (and then Verant would have most likely put in something to try to
fix it, so we would have heard about it).

The only thing I see that's possible to hack would be the graphics files,
which HAVE to be local. No way they could send that much information over
the 'net, isn't possible. So, the graphics have to be stored locally. You
could write something to alter the packets as they come in to filter out
certain graphics messages (blind, rain, nighttime, spell effects, etc), or
you might be able to hack the graphics files themseleves and just take these
affects out.

None of these bother me enough to want to wirte anything to filter packets
though.... *chuckle*

-----Original Message-----
From: kale usi [mailto:kaleusi@...]
Sent: Friday, August 27, 1999 11:17 AM
To: EQCheats@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [EQCheats] Is the verdict finally in?


From: "kale usi" <kaleusi@...>

>From: Michael O'Reilly <michael@...>
>
>I think not. I play EQ a lot from different computers. Things I have to
>set up on each new computer are hotkeys, friends list, and ignore list.
>However, my character, equipment, bank balance, faction, current buffs,
>and location remain the same.
>
>That indicates to me that all of the second list are on the server, not
>the individual computer.
>

Quite possibly true. I don't know for sure either way - in my opinion I
agree with you. However, the main thing I'm wondering at this point is -
what applications could hacking the files stored client side have? It has me

on pins and needles. I hope that nothing major comes of this. I'd hate like
hell to see my hours of work earning items, cash, etc go down the tubes. Yet

on another aspect, I'm intrigued. 8p
